abs: In this paper a non-generational genetic algorithm for multi-objective optimization problems is proposed. For each element in the population a domination count is defined together with a neighborhood density measure based on a sharing function. Those two measures are then non-linearly combined in order to define the individual 's fitness. Numerical experiments with four testproblems taken from the evolutionary multi-objective literature are performed and the results are compared with those obtained by other evolutionary techniques. 1 Introduction A number of optimization problems (specially design problems) are actually multiobjective optimization problems (MOPs) where the objectives are usually incommensurable and conflicting. As a result, there is usually not a single solution which optimizes all objectives simultaneously and a number of techniques have been developed in order to find a "good" solution to the MOP. The set of solutions which are such that no improvement can be made...
title: A Non-generational Genetic Algorithm for Multiobjective Optimization
